entry.Description: anatomical coordinate
entry.name: apical

entry.Description: top of a plant when in flower, including the stems, leaves and blooms
entry.name: flowering top

entry.Description: Seed-bearing organ on gymnosperm plants. A type of fruit, usually woody, ovoid to globular, including scales, bracts, or bracteoles arranged around a central axis, especially in conifers and cycads.
entry.French_description: organe reproducteur des conifères
entry.Spanish_description: estructura vegetal
entry.name: cone
entry.wikidataAltLabel: Cone, Conifer cones, Strobilus, pine cone, pine-cone, pinecone, pine cones

entry.Description: the female reproductive part of a flower, consisting of one or more separate or fused carpels
entry.French_description: organe femelle des plantes à fleur
entry.German_description: in der Botanik die miteinander zu einem coenokarpem Gynoeceum verwachsenen Fruchtblätter der Blüte mancher Bedecktsamer
entry.Spanish_description: la parte reproductiva femenina de una flor, consistente en uno o más carpelos, separados o fusionados.
entry.name: pistil

entry.Description: fibrous material from trees or other plants
entry.French_description: matériau naturel
entry.German_description: faseriges Material von Bäumen oder anderen Pflanzen
entry.Spanish_description: material duro y fibroso obtenido de los árboles
entry.name: wood

entry.Description: plant part used for flavoring, food, medicine, or perfume
entry.French_description: Les plantes aromatiques sont un ensemble de plantes utilisées en cuisine et en phytothérapie pour les arômes qu'elles dégagent
entry.German_description: Pflanzen, deren Blätter und Blüten frisch oder getrocknet als Gewürze Verwendung finden
entry.Spanish_description: planta usada como alimento, medicina, perfume o para dar sabor
entry.name: herb

entry.Description: A branch that is a sclerified, pointed outgrowth. Modified stems, leaves, stipules, or parts of leaves, with sharp, rigid ends (like prickles), that commonly contain vascular tissue (unlike prickles)
entry.French_description: terme générique du langage courant désignant épine foliaire, rameau-épine, aiguillon
entry.German_description: stechendes Gebilde an einer Pflanze, das an der Stelle eines Organs sitzt
entry.name: spine

entry.Description: type of herbaceous plant
entry.French_description: plante à tige dressée peu ou non lignifiée
entry.German_description: einkeimblättrige, krautige Pflanzen mit unscheinbaren Blüten und langen, schmalen Blättern
entry.name: grass

entry.Description: young stem or branch
entry.French_description: nouvelle croissance d'une plante
entry.German_description: aus Sprossachse und Blättern bestehenden, meist oberirdisch wachsenden, Teil des Kormus
entry.name: shoot

entry.Description: main organ of photosynthesis and transpiration in higher plants, usually consisting of a flat green blade attached to the stem directly or by a stalk
entry.French_description: organe spécialisé dans la photosynthèse chez les végétaux supérieurs
entry.German_description: Grundorgan der höheren Pflanzen
entry.Spanish_description: parte de una planta que sirve para hacer la fotosíntesis.
entry.name: leaf

entry.Description: embryonic plant enclosed in a protective outer covering (seed coat)
entry.French_description: structure qui contient et protège l'embryon végétal
entry.German_description: Diaspore der Samenpflanzen
entry.Spanish_description: planta embrionaria
entry.name: seed

entry.Description: organ of a higher plant that anchors the rest of the plant in the ground, absorbs water and mineral salts from the soil, and does not bear leaves or buds
entry.French_description: partie de la plante
entry.German_description: eines der drei Grundorgane der Kormophyten
entry.Spanish_description: parte de una planta
entry.name: root

entry.Description: a racemose inflorescence having many small sessile flowers borne on a fleshy stem, the whole usually being surrounded by a spathe: typical of aroid plants
entry.name: Spadix

entry.Description: part of a tree; a shoot axis that develops from an axillary bud meristem or from equal divisions of a meristematic apical cell
entry.French_description: Partie grandissante d'un arbre
entry.German_description: Teil der Wuchsform des Baumes
entry.Spanish_description: parte de un árbol
entry.name: branch

entry.Description: small, pulpy, usually edible fruit, which may or may not be a "berry" in the botanical sense
entry.name: berry

entry.Chinese_description: 植物的营养器官之一，大多数植物可见的主干
entry.Description: one of 2 main structural axes of a vascular plant (together with the root), that supports leaves, flowers and fruits, transports fluids between the roots and the shoots in the xylem and phloem, stores nutrients and produces new living tissue
entry.French_description: partie de plantes
entry.German_description: Verbindung bei Pflanzen von Wurzel und Blatt
entry.Spanish_description: órgano que sostiene las hojas, flores y frutos de una planta
entry.name: plant stem

entry.Description: sexual reproductive structure found on flowering plants
entry.French_description: partie d'une plante
entry.German_description: unverzweigter Kurzspross mit begrenztem Wachstum
entry.Spanish_description: estructura reproductiva de las plantas fanerógamas
entry.name: flower

entry.Description: part of a flowering plant
entry.French_description: organe végétal
entry.German_description: Blüte im Zustand der Samenreife
entry.Hindi_description: एक फूल वाले पौधे का हिस्सा
entry.Spanish_description: órgano de una flor que contiene las semillas de una planta
entry.name: fruit

entry.Description: fine to coarse powder containing the microgametophytes of seed plants
entry.French_description: élément fécondant mâle de la fleur
entry.German_description: Blütenstaub, auch Mehlstaub
entry.Spanish_description: polvillo compuesto por los granos portadores del gametófilo masculino en las plantas con semilla
entry.name: pollen

entry.Description: German politician (1903-1973)
entry.French_description: personnalité politique allemande
entry.German_description: deutscher Politiker (LDPD), MdV, Handelsminister der DDR
entry.Spanish_description: político alemán
entry.name: Karl Hamann

entry.Description: The male organ of a flower, consisting (usually) of a stalk called the filament and a pollen-bearing head called the anther
entry.German_description: das Pollen-erzeugende Organ in der Blüte der Bedecktsamer
entry.name: stamen

entry.Description: any of the separate parts of the calyx of a flower (excluding the bracts), usually green
entry.German_description: Blatt der äußeren Blütenhülle in der Blüte von bedecktsamigen Pflanzen
entry.name: sepal

entry.Description: Plant structure. any of the separate parts of the corolla of a flower: often brightly coloured
entry.German_description: Blatt der inneren Blütenhülle in der Blüte von bedecktsamigen Pflanzen
entry.Spanish_description: pieza que forma parte de la corola de la flor
entry.name: petal

entry.Description: one of the two types of transport tissue in vascular plants. xylems transport water from roots to shoots and leaves, but also some nutrients
entry.French_description: type de tissus des plantes vasculaires
entry.German_description: Teil der Leitbündel, Stofftransport Sprossaufwärts.
entry.name: xylem

entry.Description: Solid or highly viscous substance
entry.French_description: masse solide ou visqueuse de substances chimiques naturelles ou artificielles, solides ou visqueuses
entry.German_description: feste oder viskose Masse aus natürlichen oder künstlichen chemischen Substanzen
entry.Spanish_description: sustancia viscosa de origen vegetal o sintético
entry.name: resin

entry.Description: a form of inflorescence of the type found on the poinsettia
entry.name: cyathium

entry.Description: run botany, part of the female reproductive organ of the flower. the hollow basal region of a carpel containing one or more ovules. In some plants the carpels are united to form a single compound ovary
entry.French_description: Partie de l'organe reproducteur femelle de la fleur
entry.German_description: bauchiger Teil des Stempels, in dem sich die Samenanlage mit den Eizellen befindet
entry.Spanish_description: en botánica, parte del gineceo
entry.name: ovary

entry.Description: a compound raceme, occurring esp in grasses
entry.French_description: type d'inflorescence
entry.name: panicle

entry.Description: A reproductive shoot system that is the ultimate and congested inflorescence, especially in grasses, a racemose unit consisting of one or a few closely-packed florets born along a rachilla and subtended by two glumes
entry.German_description: Blütenstand, an dem in ährenartiger Anordnung die Blüten hinter Spelzen sitzen
entry.name: spikelet

entry.Description: unbranched, indeterminate type of inflorescence bearing pedicellate flowers along its axis
entry.name: raceme

entry.Description: an inflorescence in which the first flower is the terminal bud of the main stem and subsequent flowers develop as terminal buds of lateral stems
entry.French_description: type d'inflorescence
entry.Spanish_description: tipo de inflorescencia
entry.name: cyme

entry.Description: the outer protective layer of a fruit or vegetable which can be peeled off
entry.French_description: enveloppe extérieure d'un fruit
entry.German_description: äußere Hülle von einer Frucht
entry.Spanish_description: capa protectora de una fruta o vegetal
entry.name: peel

entry.Description: plant's underground storage organ formed by the swelling of an underground stem which produces buds and stores photosynthate metabolites/nutrients, forming a seasonal perennating organ, e.g. a potato
entry.French_description: tige souterraine verticale de plantes
entry.German_description: fleischiges, verdicktes Speicherorgan von Pflanzen, das unter der Erde wächst
entry.Spanish_description: tallo subterráneo donde se acumulan los nutrientes de reserva para la planta
entry.name: tuber

entry.Description: Underground stem in which various plants asexualy reproduce via budding.
entry.French_description: type de tige souterraine de certaines plantes
entry.German_description: Rhizome sind unterirdisch oder dicht über dem Boden wachsende Sprossachsensysteme, von denen Wurzeln in den Boden und andere Pflanzenteile aufwärts wachsen
entry.name: rhizome

entry.Description: plant tissue outside the vascular cambium or the xylem; in older trees may be divided into dead outer bark and living inner bark, which consists of secondary phloem. external parenchymal tissue, located just below the epidermis of the stem
entry.French_description: Partie extérieur du tronc d'un arbre
entry.German_description: externes parenchymales Gewebe, das sich direkt unter der Epidermis in der Primärstruktur des Stammes befindet
entry.Spanish_description: capa más externa de tallos y de raíces de plantas leñosas
entry.name: bark

entry.Description: part of a plant; living tissue that transports the soluble organic compounds made during photosynthesis (known as photosynthate), in particular the sugar sucrose, to parts of the plant where needed
entry.French_description: type de tissu végétal
entry.German_description: Bastzellen im Leitbuendel von Pflanzen
entry.Spanish_description: floema de las plantas
entry.name: phloem

entry.Description: short, enlarged shoot system that has as parts a short stem in which the shoot internodes do not elongate, and one or more buds enclosed by fleshy leaves or leaf bases
entry.French_description: pousse souterraine verticale disposant de feuilles modifiées utilisées comme organe de stockage
entry.German_description: Pflanzenteil; meist unterirdisches Speicher- und Überdauerungsorgan
entry.name: bulb

entry.Description: the part of living wood where sap flows, as distinct from the heartwood, where it doesn't
entry.French_description: bois périphérique, conduisant la sève brute
entry.German_description: äußere Holzschicht eines Baumstammes
entry.name: sapwood

entry.Description: strong central wood in a trunk or branch. the dead inner portion of the xylem (wood) of a trunk or large root
entry.French_description: partie centrale d'un tronc ou d'une branche, souvent de couleur différente du bois du pourtour (aubier) et biologiquement morte
entry.name: heartwood

entry.Description: In botany, a tissue in the stems of vascular plants. the central region of a stem, the inner part of the stele that is produced by differentiation of the ground meristem
entry.German_description: weiche Substanz im Kernbereich pflanzlicher Sprossachsen
entry.name: pith

entry.Description: in botany, a whole plant in the gametophytic phase that has a flat growth form and no distinct organs
entry.German_description: vielzellige Vegetationskörper bei Pflanzen, der nicht in Sprossachse, Wurzel und Blatt unterteilt ist
entry.Spanish_description: conjunto de la raíz, el tallo y las hojas de las plantas metafitas
entry.name: thallus

entry.Description: part of a plant. A pore or small hole in the surface a leaf (or other aerial organ) allowing the exchange of gases between tissues and the atmosphere.
entry.French_description: orifice de petite taille dans l'épiderme des organes aériens des végétaux
entry.German_description: Spaltöffnung eines Blattes
entry.name: stomata

entry.Description: slim, cylindrical flower cluster with inconspicuous or no petals. an inflorescence consisting of a spike, usually hanging, of much reduced flowers of either sex: occurs in birch, hazel, etc
entry.German_description: Form des Blütenstands
entry.name: catkin
entry.wikidataAltLabel: ament, amentaceous plants, amentiferae, amentiferous plants, catkin-bearing plants

entry.Description: insect-induced growth on plant. often very distinctive and even species-specific structures developed when insects, fungi or bacteria stimulate abnormal growth of a plant
entry.French_description: protubérance végétale causée le plus souvent par des insectes
entry.German_description: Anomalien (kugelförmige Geschwülste) im Pflanzenwachstum, die durch fremde Organismen verursacht werden
entry.name: gall

entry.Description: In botany, one of a pair of crescent-shaped cells that surround a pore (stoma) in the epidermis. Changes in the turgidity of the cells cause the opening and closing of the stoma.
entry.name: Guard cell

entry.Description: process in an organism depending on a period of light or dark of a given length
entry.German_description: genetisch bedingtes Blühverhalten, abhängig von der Tageslänge
entry.Spanish_description: reacción fisiológica de los organismos, plantas y animales, a la duración del día o la noche
entry.name: photoperiodism
entry.wikidataAltLabel: GO:0009648, response to day length, response to night length, response to photoperiod

entry.Description: a mass of cohering pollen grains, produced by plants such as orchids and transported as a whole during pollination
entry.French_description: Globule de pollen
entry.name: Pollinium

entry.Description: botanical term. Paired, modified leaves at the base of the petiole, may be membranous or leaf-like
entry.German_description: blattähnliche Auswüchse des Blattgrundes
entry.name: stipule

entry.Description: plant structure. a small body in seed-bearing plants that consists of the integument(s), nucellus, and embryosac (containing the egg cell) and develops into the seed after fertilization
entry.French_description: organe des plantes qui contient le gamète femelle
entry.German_description: Organ der Samenpflanzen, das einem von einer Hülle eingeschlossenen Megasporangium entspricht
entry.name: ovule

entry.Description: The seam or face at which two carpels adhere. Any of various joints between parts, as between the carpels, leaf lobes, etc, of a plant.
entry.French_description: Irritation des commissures bucales
entry.German_description: Verbindung zwischen Strukturen beider Köperseiten
entry.name: commissure

entry.Description: A cardinal organ part of lower plants that is the region at the distal end of either a peduncle or a pedicel where the floral appendages (e.g.: sepals, petals, stamens and pistils) are attached
entry.German_description: Abschnitt der Sprossachse, der die Organe der Blüte trägt
entry.name: receptacle

entry.Description: The collective term for the sepals and petals, or either of them if one is absent. the outer part of a flower, consisting of the calyx and corolla
entry.German_description: Gesamtheit der sterilen Blattorgane in der Blüte von Bedecktsamigen Pflanzen
entry.Spanish_description: parte no reproductiva de la flor
entry.name: perianth

entry.Description: complete set of stamens in a flower
entry.German_description: Gesamtheit der männlichen Sexualorgane in einer Blüte
entry.Spanish_description: estructura reproductora masculina que consta del conjunto de los estambres de una flor
entry.name: androecium

entry.Description: A sheath-like plant organ that surrounds the plumule of a plant embryo or the emerging shoot apex of a seedling. Protects the emerging shoot system as it grows through the soil.
entry.German_description: Schutzorgan für das aufgehende erste Blatt bei den Monokotyledonen
entry.name: Coleoptile

entry.Description: A type of inflorescence, with a monopodial growth habit, which at anthesis is composed of pedicellate flowers on a first order inflorescence axis with compressed inflorescence axis internodes. Appear as clusters originating from a single point.
entry.French_description: type d'inflorescence
entry.Spanish_description: tipo de inflorescencia
entry.name: umbel

entry.Description: the large single root of plants such as the dandelion, which grows vertically downwards and bears smaller lateral roots
entry.name: taproot

entry.Description: In botany, an awn is either a hair- or bristle-like appendage on a larger structure, or in the case of the Asteraceae, a stiff needle-like element of the pappus. In grasses awns typically extend from the lemmas of the florets.
entry.French_description: prolongement en pointe de certains organes de plantes
entry.German_description: Starrer Fortsatz eines Pflanzenorgans
entry.name: awn

entry.Description: A membranous or fleshy appendage formed by expansion of the funicle which partly or wholly covers a seed, e.g. the fleshy outer layer of lychee fruit, or that found in members of the Sapindaceae.
entry.French_description: enveloppe charnue développée autour d'une graine
entry.German_description: fleischige Hülle, die einen Samen ganz oder teilweise umhüllt
entry.name: aril

entry.Description: any of various glandular structures secreting nectar that occur in the flowers, leaves, stipules, etc, of a plant
entry.German_description: Drüsengewebe innerhalb oder außerhalb der Blüte, das den Nektar abscheidet
entry.name: Nectary

entry.Description: modified or specialized leaf, especially one associated with a reproductive structure such as a flower, inflorescence axis or cone scale
entry.French_description: pièce florale
entry.German_description: Blatt, das in seiner Blattachsel einen Seitenspross trägt
entry.name: bract

entry.Description: In botany, a term for a part of the perianth used when the sepals and petals cannot be distinguished because of similarity in size and shape. Any of the subdivisions of a perianth that is not clearly differentiated into calyx and corolla
entry.German_description: Blatt einer nicht in Kelch und Krone gegliederten Blütenhülle
entry.name: Tepal

entry.Description: A collective phyllome structure composed of two or more phyllomes immediately outside the calyx
entry.German_description: zusätzliche kelchähnliche Hülle, die außerhalb des eigentlichen Kelches direkt unterhalb der eigentlichen Blüte liegt
entry.name: epicalyx

entry.Description: water-secreting pore or gland, a small glandular structure supplied by tracheids with water-secreting epithem, often associated with a stomata which may be somewhat different in size and/or morphology from the other stomata on the plant
entry.German_description: Organ, das Wasser in flüssiger Form abgeben kann
entry.name: Hydathode

entry.Description: outermost single layer of cells in plants. the outer protective layer of cells of a plant, which may be thickened by a cuticle
entry.French_description: surface des plantes
entry.German_description: primäres Abschlussgewebe von Sprossachse und Blättern bei höheren Pflanzen
entry.name: epidermis

entry.Description: wall of a fruit, developed from the ovary/carpel wall
entry.German_description: die aus der Wand des Fruchtknotens hervorgehende Wand einer Frucht
entry.name: pericarp

entry.Description: A membranous or hairy appendage on the adaxial/upper surface of a leaf, at the junction between sheath and blade, especially in grasses
entry.German_description: Anhängsel an der Übergangsstelle von Scheide und Spreitenoberseite
entry.name: ligule

entry.Description: A cup- or tube-shaped cardinal organ part, bearing perianth and stamens on its rim, so these arise above the base, and often above the top, of the ovary
entry.German_description: becherförmige oder röhrenförmige Struktur am Grunde der Blüte
entry.name: Hypanthium

entry.Description: thickening at the base of a plant leaf
entry.German_description: verdickte Stellen in den Stielen oder an der Basis der Fiedern von Pflanzenblättern, die als Gelenke fungieren
entry.name: Pulvinus

entry.Description: remains of pressing fruit
entry.French_description: résidu de pressurage du fruit
entry.German_description: vorwiegend feste Rückstände nach dem Auspressen des Saftes von Pflanzenbestandteilen
entry.name: pomace

entry.Description: a longitudinal strand of vascular tissue in the stems and leaves of higher plants
entry.German_description: pflanzliche Struktur zum Transport von Wasser, gelösten Stoffen und organischen Substanzen
entry.name: vascular bundle

entry.Description: The basic female reproductive organ in angiosperms, either consisting of a single sporophyll or a single locule of a compound ovary, with a style and a stigma. The gynoecium is the collective term for all of the carpels of a single flower.
entry.German_description: Blütenorgan das die Samenanlagen trägt
entry.name: carpel

entry.Description: part of the female reproductive organ of plants. the part of the ovary of flowering plants to which the ovules are attached
entry.name: placenta

entry.Description: fine outgrowths or appendages on plants, algae, lichens, and certain protists. A unicellular or multicellular plant structure that forms a non-sclerified outgrowth from the epidermis
entry.French_description: poil chez les végétaux
entry.German_description: haarähnliche Strukturen auf den Oberflächen von Pflanzen, die in Größe, Form und Dichte variieren und unterschiedliche Funktionen ausüben
entry.name: trichomes

entry.Description: In botany, a loosely-packed mass of often more or less rounded cork cells occurring especially in the young stem, bark or even leaf of a plant, visible on the surface as a raised, often powdery-appearing spot, through which gaseous exchange occurs
entry.German_description: Atemöffnung von Pflanzen, meist in den Blättern
entry.Spanish_description: Protuberancia del tronco y ramas de los árboles.
entry.name: lenticel

entry.Description: needle-like leaf of some conifers
entry.French_description: feuille longue et fine de conifère
entry.name: needle

entry.Description: in a grass floret, one of a pair (or three?) of tiny green or white scales or flaps of tissue between the lemma and palea and the stamens, possibly representing reduced inner perianth members
entry.French_description: pièce florale des Poaceae
entry.name: Lodicule

entry.Description: A cluster of leaves arising from a common point resembling the arrangement of petals in a rose, ranging in form from a hemispherical tuft to a flat whorl
entry.French_description: ornement symétrique circulaire en forme de grande rose
entry.German_description: dekorative Rundelemente in stilisierter Blütenform
entry.name: rosette

entry.Description: The first stem internode above the cotyledonary node of a plant embryo or a seedling
entry.name: epicotyl

entry.Description: part of a plant. any of the hollow hairlike outgrowths of the outer cells of a root, just behind the tip, that absorb water and salts from the soil
entry.name: root hair

entry.Description: One of a pair of inflorescence bracts that is part of a spikelet and subtends the two florets. Found in Poaceae and Cyperaceae. Glumes subtend the pair of florets while a lemma or palea subtend the individual florets.
entry.French_description: bractée située à la base de l'épillet
entry.name: glume

entry.Description: capillary tube formed from a series of dead lignified cells in the xylem, or single such cell, water conducting and relatively broad, where at least the primary cell wall remains intact, and the walls are lignified, being variously banded or pitted
entry.name: tracheid

entry.Description: part of a flower. The pollen-receptive surface of a carpel or group of fused carpels, usually sticky; usually a point or small head at the summit of the style where deposited pollen germinates
entry.French_description: partie d'une fleur
entry.German_description: oberer Abschnitt des Stempels des Fruchtblattes einer Blüte
entry.name: stigma

entry.Description: the part of a plant that bears the reproductive organs
entry.German_description: Träger der Geschlechtsorgane der Archegonien und der Antheridien
entry.name: Gametophore

entry.Description: Plant part. An elongated part of a carpel or a group of fused carpels between the ovary and the stigma.
entry.French_description: partie allongée du gynécée d'une fleur
entry.German_description: Teil eines Stempels einer Blüte der die Narbe trägt
entry.name: Style

entry.Description: structure connecting flowers or fruit to the main stem of a plant
entry.French_description: tige portant les fleurs individuelles d'une inflorescence
entry.name: pedicel

entry.Description: the petals of a flower collectively, forming an inner floral envelope
entry.French_description: constituant d'un végétal
entry.German_description: Gesamtheit der Kron- oder Blütenblätter (Petalen) in einer Blüte mit doppelter Blütenhülle
entry.Spanish_description: verticilo interno de las flores que tienen perianto heteroclamídeo
entry.name: corona

entry.Description: botanical term for a slender, tubular appendage extending backward from the base of a sepal or petal
entry.German_description: Teil einer Blütenpflanze
entry.name: spur

entry.Description: the central part of a plant ovule containing the embryo sac
entry.German_description: Gewebe in der Samenanlage der Samenpflanzen, das die Megasporen ausbildet
entry.name: nucellus

entry.Description: an inflorescence in the form of a flat-topped flower cluster with the oldest flowers at the periphery. This type of raceme occurs in the candytuft
entry.German_description: Form des Blütenstands
entry.name: corymb

entry.Description: the stalk of a plant bearing an inflorescence or solitary flower
entry.French_description: tige florale
entry.German_description: bei Blütenpflanzen derjenige Abschnitt einer Sprossachse, der unterhalb des Blütenstandes liegt und diesen trägt
entry.name: Peduncle

entry.Description: in botany, the stalk of the stamen
entry.name: Filament

entry.Description: A gemma (plural gemmae) is a single cell, or a mass of cells, or a modified bud of tissue, that detaches from the parent and develops into a new individual. This type of asexual reproduction is referred to as fragmentation.
entry.name: Gemma

entry.Description: part of a flower. A collective phyllome structure that is composed of one or more sepals, and comprises the outer whorl (floral envelope) of non-reproductive floral organs that protects the developing flower bud
entry.French_description: ensemble des sépales
entry.German_description: Gesamtheit der Kelchblätter (Sepalen) in einer Blüte mit doppelter Blütenhülle
entry.Spanish_description: verticilo externo en las flores
entry.name: calyx

entry.Description: flat part of a leaf
entry.German_description: der flächige Teil eines Blattes
entry.Spanish_description: parte de una hoja
entry.name: leaf blade

entry.Description: In botany, the lower, usually larger, of two bracts enclosing a floret (the other is the palea), in a grass spikelet
entry.name: lemma

entry.Description: Radicle forms the future root
entry.German_description: erste, noch unverzweigte Anlage der Wurzel am Embryo
entry.name: Radicle

entry.Description: structure in seed plants that gives rise to and contains the female reproductive cells
entry.French_description: ouverture dans le tégument de l'ovule des plantes à graine
entry.name: micropyle

entry.Description: botany term. A protective case, covering, or structure, such as a plant bud, in which an organism remains dormant for the winter.
entry.name: Hibernaculum

entry.Description: the inner of two bracts surrounding each floret in a grass spikelet
entry.name: Palea

entry.Description: a shoot or branch growing from the main stem of a plant
entry.name: Offshoot

entry.Description: the stalk of a leaf
entry.French_description: Élément d'une feuille
entry.name: petiole

entry.Description: A small, deciduous bulb or tuber formed in the axil of a leaf or pinna; a means of vegetative propagation
entry.name: bulbil

entry.Description: small thin terminal branch of a woody plant
entry.German_description: Verzweigung eines Stängels bzw. Asts einer Pflanze
entry.name: twig

entry.Description: a cymose inflorescence in which each branch bearing a flower gives rise to two other flowering branches, as in the stitchwort
entry.name: Dichasium

entry.Description: Plant cell, usually two in number, in the micropylar end of the embryo sac of angiosperms associated with the egg in the egg apparatus
entry.name: synergid

entry.Description: an elongation of the receptacle of a flower between the calyx and corolla
entry.Tamil_description: புல்லி வட்டத்திற்கும் அல்லி வட்டத்திற்கும் இடையே பூத்தளம் நீட்சியடைதல்
entry.name: anthophore

entry.Description: the main (aerial) stem of a plant
entry.name: caulis

entry.Description: a cymose inflorescence in which each branch gives rise to one other branch only, as in the forget-me-not and buttercup
entry.name: monochasium

entry.Description: collective name for leaves of a tree or plant
entry.German_description: Gesamtheit der Blattorgane von Laubbäumen und Sträuchern.
entry.name: foliage

entry.Description: A plant organ that is part of a flower
entry.name: floral organ

entry.Description: A steath-like plant organ that surrounds the radicle of a plant embryo or the emerging root of a seedling.
entry.German_description: scheidenförmiges Hüllorgan bei den Embryonen der Süßgräser, das die Wurzelanlage des Embryos haubenförmig umgibt
entry.name: coleorhiza

entry.Description: A flower development stage that begins when pollen is released by anther dehiscence and/or the stigma is receptive and ends with the process of pollination and/or floral organ senescence
entry.French_description: processus biologique de développement des fleurs.
entry.name: flowering

entry.Description: individual true flower within an inflorescence. A small flower, esp one of many making up the head of a composite flower.
entry.name: floret

entry.Description: The secondary axis of a branched inflorescence
entry.name: rachilla

entry.Description: scientific article published on 06 June 2014
entry.German_description: im Juni 2014 veröffentlichter wissenschaftlicher Artikel
entry.name: Complement Fixing Polysaccharides from Terminalia macroptera Root Bark, Stem Bark and Leaves
entry.term: Complement Fixing Polysaccharides from Terminalia macroptera Root Bark, Stem Bark and Leaves

entry.Description: scientific article published on 01 December 2002
entry.German_description: im Dezember 2002 veröffentlichter wissenschaftlicher Artikel
entry.name: Investigation on the wound healing activity of oleo-resin from Copaifera langsdorffi in rats
entry.term: Investigation on the wound healing activity of oleo-resin from Copaifera langsdorffi in rats

entry.Description: The sac-like or scale-like structure that encloses the ovary in Carex
entry.name: Perigynium
